results.title: Asterix and the big fight
results.creator_credit: Philippe Grimond, Nicolas Pesques, Gaumont and ExtraFilm Produktion
results.brief_description: In this, the sixth animated Asterix feature, Asterix, Obelix and their faithful canine Dogmatix are left alone to defend their village against the Romans after the rest of the villagers have fled from a terrible thunderstorm. Unfortunately for them the druid Getafix has lost his memory after being accidently knocked unconscious with a menhir by Obelix and is unable to remember the formula for the potion that gives Asterix the superhuman strength he relies on to defeat the Romans. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philippe Grimond, Nicolas Pesques, Gaumont and ExtraFilm Produktion

results.title: The Firefighter, Police helicopter, Police officer
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Shows the work done by a firefighter, by policemen who man the police helicopter and the work of a various police officers from senior sargents to motor cycle police. The duties and responsibilities of each profession and the necessary equipment and supplies required by each person in order to get the job done.

results.title: Assorted Film Making Accessories
results.brief_description: “Coated Walz Filter for Color Film housed in original cardboard box. Walz brand clear plastic case with lid and base. Metal rimmed light brown/orange glass lens. Instructions included Kodak Kodachrome 25 colour movie film daylight for 8mm roll (7.5m KM459P) Tin can embossed with Kodak logo on the top. Unused reel of film. Tin sealed together with black duct tape. Original box Envelope Instructions Film price includes processing by Kodak. Mailing envelope enclosed (this has never been used and is folded in a small square) 7.5 metres in length of douible 8mm film on this roll which is intended to yield 15 metres in length of 8mm movies. The additional film at each end serves as leader and trailer for light protection and camera loading. Process before Oct 1979. KM459P CAT 416 9918 Daylight, ASA 25, 15 DIN 2 pairs of mono ear buds to be plugged in to a crystal radio. 1. Brown leather pouch with pink ear bud. 2. Black vinyl puch with cream ear bud. Sunbeam lens brush. Sundry cord in ziplock bag. National brand. Could possibly have been a cord to connect flash. However there doesn’t see to be a donated item which this pairs with. Cyldon brand film reel. (for 8mm) Light metal (tin?). Made in England Markers for 50, 100, 150 and 200 feet.”

results.title: At the supermarket
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Non-narrated. Shows us some of the people who help run a supermarket. Apart from the familiar helpers such as checkout cashiers, and sales assistants we also see people who prepare meat and vegetables for sale, those who order and take delivery of stock and night fillers.

results.title: Assertive team communication
results.creator_credit: Cathy Beitz, Tracy Riddiford and Our Bizniss Productions
results.brief_description: This video package is designed for a half day group training session on assertive communication within a team environment. The manual provides background notes, suggested activities and pages to copy for overhead transparencies and the kit is flexible enough to apply to any work environment.

results.title: Assault on Precinct 13
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, J Kaplan and CKK Corporation
results.brief_description: In John Carpenter’s low-budget classic, the skeleton crew of a ghetto police station fights off a horde of street thugs who are seeking revenge against a locked-up prisoner. It’s a ‘Rio Bravo’ for the lawless modern age; once the siege starts, the screen appears to explode in bullets and flying glass. The action is so raw it doesn’t seem choreographed, so fast it doesn’t seem plausible.

results.title: Assassin of youth
results.creator_credit: Elmer Clifton, Leo McCarthy and B C M Productions
results.brief_description: Joan is a good-natured teenager who, along with her sister, is set to receive her grandmother’s inheritance. When her grandmother is run over by a driver under the influence of marijuana, a reporter is sent to investigate. Meanwhile Joan’s scheming cousin Linda, intent on receiving the money herself, determines to have Joan dis-inherited by ruining her clean-cut reputation. The reporter on the case, who has fallen for Joan, discovers that Linda is a drug peddler and that Joan’s sister has become addicted to marijuana. “Assassin of youth” is an anti-drug teen propaganda movie typical of the 1930s. A fairly stilted and straightforward morality drama, this film has an almost transparent agenda, is patriarchal, traditionalist and simplistic in its politics. Nevertheless the film is a curiosity that is telling about the values of the era and perceived threat that teenagers under the influence posed to the status quo. Cast includes Luana Walters, Arthur Gardner, Fay McKenzie, Michael Owen, Dorothy Short, Dorothy Vaughan, Earl Dwire.

results.title: At the Land's End: the Wilson's Promontory National Park
results.creator_credit: David Swift, Wilson's Promontory Committee of Management, Parks Victoria and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film shows the breathtaking landscape, the wildlife and the facilities for holiday-makers at Tidal River. The work of the ranger is described and there are two outstanding sequences dealing with the Smoking Cliffs at Darby River and gannets diving off Five-Mile Beach. Narrated by Wynn Roberts.

results.title: At the height of summer = Vertical ray of the sun = Mua he chieu thang dung
results.creator_credit: Tran Anh Hung, Christophe Rossignon, Hang Phim Truyen, ZDF Arte, Arte France, Studio Canal+ and Jerry Zucker
results.brief_description: Tran Anh Hung’s “At the Height of Summer” conveys the complexity and beauty of life in a completely unsentimental and un-moralistic manner. The story centres on a trio of sisters who live in contemporary Hanoi and whose closeness reflects the sanctity of the family. The duration of the story is one month and is framed by the celebration of their mother and father’s death anniversaries respectively. Beneath the surface of familial tranquillity and calmness, however, lies a sea of anxiety and instability. The elder sister is married to a husband who harbours a shocking secret; the middle sister questions her husband’s loyalty just as they are beginning a family; and the youngest sister, a strong and idealistic woman, experiences unrequited love whilst having a strong affinity for her brother that is only shades away from being a true relationship. Although “At the Height of Summer” does not contain the same overt political references as “Cyclo”, the same stylistic flair evident in that film continues here. Almost every shot in “At the Height of Summer” is filled with the abundant surface beauty of the world. From facial close-ups of the elegant sisters to a ray of light to a pelter of rain to a dead chicken’s hand to the passing of time, Hung captures the sensuousness of everyday Hanoi in a riveting, truly compelling manner. And in this way, his film assumes an air of poetry and lyricism that lends its subject-matter a sense of profound humility. Cast includes Tran Nu Yen-Khe, Nhu Quynh Nguyen, Chu Hung, Le Tuan Anh. In Vietnamese with English subtitles.
